## Overview

This document outlines the rental and leasing policies for [COMMUNITY NAME] as established in the Declaration of Covenants, Conditions, and Restrictions (CC&Rs).

---

## General Rental Policy

[COMMUNITY NAME] [PERMITS/RESTRICTS] the rental of residential properties subject to the following conditions and restrictions.

---

## Minimum Lease Term

- **Minimum lease duration:** [12 MONTHS / 6 MONTHS / NO MINIMUM]
- Short-term rentals (less than 30 days) are [PROHIBITED / PERMITTED with restrictions]
- Month-to-month leases are [PROHIBITED / PERMITTED after initial term]

---

## Rental Cap (If Applicable)

[OPTION 1 - Rental Cap:]
- Maximum [X%] of homes in the community may be rented at any time
- Waitlist available when cap is reached
- Contact management for current availability

[OPTION 2 - No Cap:]
- There is no limit on the number of rental properties in the community

---

## Short-Term Rental Policy

[OPTION 1 - Prohibited:]
- Short-term rentals (Airbnb, VRBO, vacation rentals) are **PROHIBITED**
- Rentals must be for a minimum of [12 MONTHS]

[OPTION 2 - Permitted with Restrictions:]
- Short-term rentals permitted with board approval
- Maximum [X] rentals per month/year
- Must register with management
- Owner remains responsible for tenant behavior

---

## Lease Requirements

### Required Lease Terms
All leases must include the following provisions:

1. **Lease must be in writing** - No verbal agreements
2. **Entire property only** - No room rentals or subletting without approval
3. **Single-family use** - Property must be used as a single-family residence
4. **CC&R compliance** - Tenant agrees to comply with all community rules
5. **HOA addendum** - Lease must include the HOA addendum (available from management)

---

## Owner Responsibilities

Property owners who rent their homes must:

1. **Register the rental** with the management company
2. **Provide tenant information:**
   - Tenant name(s)
   - Tenant contact phone and email
   - Number of occupants
   - Vehicle information (make, model, license plate)
   - Emergency contact

3. **Provide tenants with:**
   - Copy of CC&Rs
   - Community rules and regulations
   - Pool access information (if applicable)
   - Gate access codes (if applicable)
   - Management company contact information

4. **Remain responsible** for:
   - All tenant violations (fines assessed to owner)
   - Assessment payments
   - Property maintenance
   - Tenant compliance with rules

---

## Tenant Responsibilities

Tenants must:

1. Comply with all CC&Rs and community rules
2. Maintain the property in good condition
3. Pay for any damage to common areas
4. Not sublease or sublet without written approval
5. Register all vehicles with the community
6. Obtain pool/amenity access through proper channels

---

## Violations by Tenants

- All violations are assessed to the property **OWNER**, not the tenant
- Owner is responsible for correcting tenant violations
- Repeated tenant violations may result in:
  - Fines to owner
  - Suspension of rental privileges
  - Legal action

---

## Registration Process

To register a rental property:

1. Complete the **Rental Registration Form** (available at [PORTAL URL])
2. Provide a copy of the executed lease
3. Pay the **rental registration fee** of $[AMOUNT] (if applicable)
4. Submit tenant information as required above
5. Provide evidence of landlord liability insurance

**Registration must be renewed** [ANNUALLY / with each new tenant]

## Fees

| Fee Type | Amount |

| Rental Registration (one-time) | $[AMOUNT] |
| Annual Renewal | $[AMOUNT] |
| Lease Transfer Fee | $[AMOUNT] |
| Late Registration Penalty | $[AMOUNT] |

---

## Corporate Ownership

Properties owned by corporations, LLCs, or trusts:
- Must designate a responsible individual for communications
- Subject to the same rental restrictions
- May require additional documentation

---

## Prohibited Activities

The following are prohibited for rental properties:

- Operating a business from the home (beyond home office)
- Commercial activities
- Multiple unrelated tenants sharing the property
- Subletting without approval
- Renting rooms individually

---

## Insurance Requirements

Owners who rent their properties must:
- Maintain adequate landlord liability insurance
- Provide proof of insurance upon request
- Notify insurance company of rental status
